intro: Thymus borgiae, commonly known as the Borgia thyme, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to the island of Sicily and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It is a low-growing perennial that is often used in ornamental gardening due to its compact form and fragrant foliage. Thymus borgiae is also valued for its essential oils, which are used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine.
